videos.title: Colorado Trail Bike Packing Durango to Denver
videos.description:
Not all videos of bike packing the Colorado Trail end in a joyful finish. Three months out from my last radiation treatment for neck and oral cancer I under took bike packing the Colorado Trail from Durango to Denver (that's the hard way). The bicycle has always been an important part of my life, but in 2020 with a cancer diagnosis and COVID19 it has been so much more-- a life life, a motivational tool and a way to remind myself of the simple joys of life. This video gives you a brief snapshot of the beauty and the harshness of  bike packing the CT. 

If you like that snazzy sun hat bike helmet combo I have on in the vide check out DaBrim http://www.dabrim.com/index.html 
In looking for a way to keep the sun off my freshly radiated and sun sensitive face and neck, I found this hat better than any sunscreen. 

I started Bikes Kill Cancer as an Instagram account in 2020 to keep friends and family looped in on my cancer journey. In six short months, it has become so much more. I've used Bikes Kill Cancer as a catalyst for raising over $6000 for cancer and COVID research, a place to post bicycle and cancer related videos and hopefully as a way to share the joys of riding bicycles and being outside. 

Follow me on Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/bikeskillcancer/
Blog- https://bikeskillcancer.art.blog

videos.title: Bikepacking The Entire Colorado Trail-Denver to Durango
videos.description:
SUBSCRIBE TO DUZERTV FOR ENDLESS ADVENTURE! ► http://bit.ly/DUZERTVSUB
The Colorado Trail spans 550 miles from Denver to Durango. Along the way, riders (or hikers) travel over stunning mountains while passing through some of the state's most beautiful terrain. This experience tested me in every way, I mean, there's 72k feet of elevation gain, it's HARD! I took on this challenge in July of 2021.
All the details about my bike, the Priority 600x https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Do8MFVjHHIM&t=2s
Here's my gear setup: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=It_EwkLh0PA
This is how I pack my bikepacking bags: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BAjf2UY15AU&t=274s
Here's the full series of the Colorado Trail https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQntYl1jtMXsxtuthvbuo6D1kvmSSKbhq

Help support my channel 
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/RyanVanDuzer
Paypal Tip Jar: http://bit.ly/RyanVanDuzer (choose Family and Friends to eliminate fees)
Venmo @RyanVanDuzer

**Welcome to DuzerTV** This channel is dedicated to inspiring viewers to get off their couches and explore this beautiful world (or even your backyard). You'll find videos about biking, running, trekking, traveling, do goodery, and anything that involves being outside and enjoying life. Join TeamDuzer and let's have some fun!

#RyanVanDuzer #TeamDuzer #ColoradoTrail

videos.title: Bikepacking The Colorado Trail | EP 2 Durango Or Bust (Waterton Canyon to Kenosha Pass)
videos.description:
This is send off day. We woke up early. Had pancakes and headed north to the trailhead. Emily graciously sacrificed her beauty rest to get us up there. Then we loaded the sleds and set off for Kenosha Pass! Big day but it was good to cover some ground on day one. Even if it hurt some… And there were still 6 more days to go, optimistically speaking.
https://bike.shimano.com/en-US/home.html
https://www.konaworld.com
https://www.maxxis.com/tires/bicycle

videos.title: The Rig That Won The Colorado Trail Race - Neil Beltchenko
videos.description:
Last week, Neil finished his fourth Colorado Trail Race, arriving in Denver as the first rider across the finish line. In this video, he offers a detailed look at his rig, including the components, bags, and everything he was carrying. He also answers some of your questions about the race and his choice of rig.

Do you enjoy our videos, routes, and articles? Help sustain this resource by joining the Bikepacking Collective:  https://bikepacking.com/join/?utm_source=youtube

Outline:
Intro - 0:00
History - 0:48
Bike - 2:51
Components - 4:08
Bags - 11:39
On the body - 19:05
Support & Subscribe - 26:13
Q&A - 26:50

Edit:
I said 28 hole Industry Nine Wheels, but I meant to say 24 hole. Sorry for the confusion. 

Mentioned Links:
GARMIN ETREX 32X REVIEW - https://bikepacking.com/gear/garmin-etrex-32x-review-video/
BIKEPACKING REPAIR KIT & TOOLS: ESSENTIAL AND AUXILIARY - https://bikepacking.com/gear/bikepacking-repair-kit/
GUIDE TO BIKE CHAIN REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE - https://bikepacking.com/gear/bike-chain-repair-and-maintenance/


Do you enjoy our videos, routes, and articles? Help sustain this resource by joining the Bikepacking Collective:  https://bikepacking.com/join/?utm_source=youtube

#pedalfurther #bikepacking #coloradotrail

-------------
Hosted by Neil Beltchenko (@Neil_Beltchenko)
Music by Ben Weaver (https://benweaver.net)
More at https://bikepacking.com
